maxGenerationTokens.label: Max Generation Tokens
maxGenerationTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate by the LLM in the chat completion. This value is passed to the LLM API provider to limit how much the model is allowed to generate.

maxPromptTokens.label: Max Input Tokens
maxPromptTokens.description: Maximum number of 'input' tokens to submit to LLM. This includes your latest message, the System Prompt, and previous conversation context messages (starting from most recent) - as much as fits into this limit. With high limit, compute costs ramp up quikly with extended conversations! Be careful, restart chats often or edit messages instead of adding more

temperature.label: Temperature
temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more variable and explorative, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top p but not both.

presencePenalty.label: Presence Penalty
presencePenalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalise new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics. (Default: 0)

topP.label: Top-p
topP.description: Number between 0 and 1. An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens in the top 10% probability mass are considered.

frequencyPenalty.label: Frequency Penalty
frequencyPenalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalise new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim. (Default: 0)
